result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo A. Holloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with 15CF1218, But Consecutive to 12CF2772, 13CF808 and 13CF2880.
Court allows Deft may be transferred to another Institution.

superMiscConds.notes: $518 DOC Collect within first 12 months after Release to Extended Supervision;  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo A. Holloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ricardo A. Holloway in court with attorney Anthony C. Delyea.  Anthony C. Delyea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads Guilty freely and voluntarily; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: 20 years bifurcated sentence: 12 years WSPrison, 8 years Extended Supervision; Concurrent with 15CF1218, Consecutive to 12CF2772, 13CF808,13CF2880; 220 days credit.

Defendant Ricardo A. Holloway in court in custody with attorney Anthony C. Delyea.  Perry L Folts appeared with Katharine Buker for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
